description: Each c(i) is "multiply" (*) or "divide" (/); d(1) = 1 < d(2) < ... < d(m) = n are the divisors of n; a(n) is number of choices for c(1), ..., c(m-1) so that d(1) c(1) d(2) c(2) d(3), .., c(m-1) d(m) is an integer.
comments: a(A008578(n)) = 1; a(A002808(n)) > 1; a(n) = number of partitions of the set of divisors of n into two subsets U and V such that min(U) < min(V) and product(V) divides product(U). [_Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 05 2012]
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
prog: (Haskell)import Data.List (subsequences, (\\))a060448 n = length [us | let ds = a027750_row n,                         us <- init $ tail $ subsequences ds,                         let vs = ds \\ us, head us < head vs,                         product us `mod` product vs == 0] + 1-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 05 2012
author: _Naohiro Nomoto_, Apr 14 2001
